Notes: Schools must offer ACT, but students are not required to participate.

3-8 Test: Partnership for Assessment of Readiness for College and Careers (PARCC)
Notes: PARCC in grades 3-9.

3-8 Test: Partnership for Assessment of Readiness for College and Careers (PARCC)

Notes: Students must pass end-of-course tests.
Students must take 10th grade Smarter Balanced and SAT or ACT.

3-8 Test: Partnership for Assessment of Readiness for College and Careers (PARCC)
Indiana Statewide Testing for Educational Progress Plus (ISTEP+)
Notes: Students must pass end-of-course tests.

3-8 Test: Kentucky Performance Rating for Educational Progress (K-PREP)
MIX: Partnership for Assessment of Readiness for College and Careers (PARCC) and Louisiana Educational Assessment Program (LEAP)
Notes: LEAP is a mix of PARCC and Louisiana-designed items. Students must pass end-of-course tests.

3-8 Test: Partnership for Assessment of Readiness for College and Careers (PARCC)
MIX: "Next Generation" Massachusetts Comprehensive Assessment System (MCAS) and Partnership for Assessment of Readiness for College and Careers (PARCC)
Notes: "Next gen" MCAS is a mix of PARCC & MCAS items. 10th grade MCAS uses Massachusetts-designed items. Students must pass MCAS.

3-8 Test: MIX: Smarter Balanced Assessment Consortium (SBAC) and Michigan Student Test of Educational Progress (M-STEP)
Notes: M-STEP is a mix of Smarter Balanced and Michigan-created items.
Students must pass MAP end-of-course tests or substitute ACT scores, dual-enrollment courses, or other tests.

3-8 Test: Smarter Balanced Assessment Consortium (SBAC),Performance Assessment of Competency Education (PACE)
Notes: In eight districts, schools give SBAC once in elementary and middle school. In all other grade levels, they use locally designed performance tests, called PACE, and give SAT in 11th grade. In all other districts, schools give SBAC in grades 3-8 and SAT in grade 11.

3-8 Test: Partnership for Assessment of Readiness for College and Careers (PARCC)
Notes: Students must pass PARCC end-of-course tests, or produce threshold scores on ACT, SAT, or Accuplacer, or present a portfolio.

3-8 Test: Partnership for Assessment of Readiness for College and Careers (PARCC)
Notes: Students must score at Level 3 on PARCC.
Students must pass Regents Exams.
Students must take ACT or WorkKeys; score doesn't affect grades or graduation.
Students must take SAT or ACT. To graduate, they can pass the Ohio Graduation Exams or produce threshold scores on end-of-course-exams, ACT, or SAT.

3-8 Test: Partnership for Assessment of Readiness for College and Careers (PARCC)
Notes: SAT is offered during the school day, but students are not required to take it.
Students must take ACT or SAT.

3-8 Test: State of Texas Assessments of Academic Readiness (STAAR)
Notes: Students must pass end-of-course tests.

3-8 Test: Student Assessment of Growth and Excellence (SAGE)

Notes: Students must pass end-of-course tests or state-board-approved substitute test.
Class of 2017 must produce threshold score on SBAC in English/language arts. In math, students must pass SBAC or end-of-course exams.
